page.title: 06RESERVOIRS AT LINACRE
page.content: There are{3 reservoirs at Linacre. Reservoirs are{man-made lakes for {storing water.}These reservoirs{supply {water for domestic and industrial use to the{Chesterfield area. {Reservoir Date Capacity Depth Surface {million in area {gallons feet acres Lower 1855 31 31 8 Middle 1904 90 42 17 Upper 1865 126 61 18 In{1909 a sand filter and chlorination {plant}was installed. The sediment in the water is left in a layer of sand as it passes through.{Chlorine}is added to kill bacteria.{Lime}is added to soften the water and make it easier to wash with. It also prevents scaling and rust in the metal pipes.The water comes from the{River Derwent.}The reservoirs are run by the{Severn Trent {Water Authority.
